Sentencas: In the present study, a novel concept of cooling solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) stacks with phase change heat transfer of saturated water is proposed in order to provide an additional means to control the temperature distribution of SOFC stacks with small parasitic energy consumption.
Titulo: Feasibility study on saturated water cooled solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: Three-dimensional computational fluid dynamics modeling with an electrochemistry solver is used to simulate the SOFC operations.
Titulo: Feasibility study on saturated water cooled solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: By comparing the proposed water-cooled stack with the conventional air-cooled stack, it is found that water cooling significantly improves the temperature distribution inside the stack, leading to better electrochemical performance.
Titulo: Feasibility study on saturated water cooled solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: The temperature difference of the tubular SOFC can be reduced from 295 K in the air-cooled stack to 62 K in the water-cooled stack with the same operating conditions.
Titulo: Feasibility study on saturated water cooled solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: In the planar SOFC, it can be reduced from 185 K to 26 K.
Titulo: Feasibility study on saturated water cooled solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: It is also shown that water cooling can greatly reduce the air flow rate in the stack without much affecting the thermal condition.
Titulo: Feasibility study on saturated water cooled solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: Using water cooling, air utilization can be as high as 80%, leading to the reduction of parasitic air blowing power.
Titulo: Feasibility study on saturated water cooled solid oxide fuel cell stack
